intro: Adenoplea baccata, commonly known as the red-fruited adenoplea, is a small shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are bright red, fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Adenoplea baccata is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
